poem:
Title: Streaming Elegy

Anew, the reel spins not in darkened halls,
But in the web-woven void with no face.
Once cinema's scorned, now rule digital sprawls,
Cardboard-palace princesses, lost in cyberspace.
Twelve drab disciples of Dudikoff remain,
Stripped of celluloid sanctity, bathed in LED light.
It's the filmmaker's resurrection, yet still a bane,
For the soul of cinema drifts out of sight.
